meanings.definition: Extremely dry; having very little or no rainfall.
meanings.sent1: The desert was hyperarid, with no rain for months.
meanings.sent2: The hyperarid conditions made it difficult for plants to grow.
meanings.sent3: The hyperarid land was so dry that even the cacti looked thirsty.
meanings.sent4: Her throat felt as hyperarid as the desert after hours of talking.
meanings.sent5: The hyperarid climate turned the once lush landscape into a barren wasteland.

meanings.definition: A region or climate characterized by extremely low levels of precipitation.
meanings.sent1: Living in a hyperarid region meant conserving every drop of water.
meanings.sent2: The hyperarid of the desert made farming nearly impossible.
meanings.sent3: The hyperarid was so severe that even the clouds seemed parched.
meanings.sent4: In the hyperarid, rain was a rare and cherished gift.
meanings.sent5: The hyperarid landscape stretched for miles without a hint of greenery.
